text: hey everyone this is a project that I
use every once in a while this is an
automatic cat feeder so let me show you
how it works the feeder is built from a
commercially made cereal dispenser this
thing I bought it fries but it's kind of
like a target you know kind of Walmart
type item and it originally had just a
handle that was attached where that
motor is now and so by turning the
handle some of the contents would be
dispensed at the point where the cereal
is actually dispensed there's kind of
like a butterfly valve inside here and
it's made of rubber and it has six
blades instead of just two so that as
you rotate it there's like a specific
quantity that gets dispensed each time
for each sixth of a revolution so
originally I had this connected up with
an old HP LaserJet motor and what I did
is I had a darkroom timer and I just ran
the motor for a specific amount of time
for one sixth of a revolution to occur
but that dead ended up not working out
too well because the motor you know
would vary speed a little bit and it
would sometimes not dispense any food
and other times it dispensed twice as
much so what I did here is at a stepper
motor and behind it there's a circuit
board with an 80 mega eight which is
pretty overkill for this project but I
have a lot of them in my shop which is
why I used it so you can zoom in there
there it is and I used my my classic
transistor circuit here just a bunch of
p-n 22 22s just like in the other video
and each time the power is turned on
that 18 mega steps the motor through is
enough steps so that 1/6 of a revolution
will occur at the dispenser so this is
just a gearbox that was originally part
of the laser jet motor the power cord
just has a standard you know wall wart
transformer there and on the plug side
there is one of these rotary mechanical
timer devices so three times a day the
timer is turned on power is applied to
the 18 mega eighth and the theater will
dispense
set volume of food so let's let's give
it a try I'm going to activate the timer
manually just as if it had been
triggered by one of the teeth coming
around on the timer
[Applause]
so the light comes on here to indicate
that it still has power and then
eventually when the tooth on the timer
you know goes past the point that the
power will be cut off and it'll be ready
to be triggered again all right see you
next time bye
